MINUTES OF THE SITTING OF 21 SEPTEMBER 2010 IN THE CHAIR: Jerzy BUZEK President 1. Opening of the sitting The sitting opened at 9.05. 2. Action taken on Parliament’s resolutions The Commission communication on the action it had taken in response to the resolutions adopted by Parliament during the May I 2010 part-session was available on the Séance en direct site. 3. Security of gas supply ***I (debate) Report on the proposal for a regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council concerning measures to safeguard security of gas supply and repealing Directive 2004/67/EC [2009/0108(COD)] - Committee on Industry, Research and Energy. Rapporteur: Alejo Vidal-Quadras (A7-0112/2010) Alejo Vidal-Quadras introduced the report. The following spoke: Günther Oettinger (Member of the Commission). The following spoke: Bogusław Sonik (rapporteur for the opinion of the ENVI Committee), Sandra Kalniete (rapporteur for the opinion of the IMCO Committee) and Jacek Saryusz-Wolski (rapporteur for the opinion of the AFET Committee), Herbert Reul, on behalf of the PPE Group, Hannes Swoboda, on behalf of the S&D Group, Adina-Ioana Vălean, on behalf of the ALDE Group, Claude Turmes, on behalf of the Verts/ALE Group, Konrad Szymański, on behalf of the ECR Group, Jacky Hénin, on behalf of the GUE/NGL Group, Niki Tzavela, on behalf of the EFD Group, Béla Kovács, Non-attached Member, Arturs Krišjānis Kariņš, Teresa Riera Madurell, Jorgo Chatzimarkakis, Evžen Tošenovský, Fiorello Provera, Nick Griffin, Amalia Sartori, Marek Siwiec, Norica Nicolai, Adam Bielan, Jaroslav Paška, Romana Jordan Cizelj, Anni Podimata, Ivo Strejček, Bogdan Kazimierz Marcinkiewicz and George Sabin Cutaș. They are published in hard copy in the Result of roll-call votes annex. The electronic version on Europarl will be regularly updated for a maximum of two weeks after the day of the vote concerned. After the two-week deadline has passed, the list of corrections to votes and voting intentions will be finalised so that it can be translated and published in the Official Journal. * * * Bernd Posselt and Ioannis A. The following spoke: Francesca Balzani, on behalf of the S&D Group, Isabelle Durant, on behalf of the Verts/ALE Group, Marta Andreasen, on behalf of the EFD Group, Franz Obermayr, Non-attached Member, and Reimer Böge. Vote: minutes of 22.9.2010, item 5.2 . (The sitting was suspended at 18.35 pending Question Time and resumed at 19.00.) IN THE CHAIR: Edward McMILLAN-SCOTT Vice-President 13. Question Time (Commission) Parliament considered a number of questions to the Commission (B7-0462/2010). Question 21 (Vilija Blinkevičiūtė): Further EU action on combating violence against women. László Andor (Member of the Commission) answered the question and supplementaries by Vilija Blinke­ vičiūtė and Franz Obermayr. Question 22 (Marian Harkin): Regulation (EC) No 1083/2006. László Andor answered the question and a supplementary by Marian Harkin. Question 23 lapsed as its author was absent. EN C 320 E/26 Official Journal of the European Union 25.11.2010 Tuesday 21 September 2010

Question 24 (Marc Tarabella): Impact of the liberalisation of the energy market on consumers. Günther Oettinger (Member of the Commission) answered the question and supplementaries by Marc Tarabella, Silvia-Adriana Țicău and Franz Obermayr. Question 25 (Silvia-Adriana Țicău): Regional cooperation in energy-related matters. Günther Oettinger answered the question and a supplementary by Silvia-Adriana Țicău. Question 26 (Nikolaos Chountis): Liberalisation of the energy sector in Greece. Günther Oettinger answered the question and supplementaries by Takis Hadjigeorgiou, deputising for the author, Anni Podimata and Georgios Papanikolaou. Question 27 (Salvatore Iacolino): Oil drilling in the Mediterranean. Günther Oettinger answered the question and a supplementary by Salvatore Iacolino, Paul Rübig and Radvilė Morkūnaitė-Mikulėnienė. Question 33 (Ioannis A. Tsoukalas): Need for radical restructuration of the European research funding framework. Máire Geoghegan-Quinn (Member of the Commission) answered the question and supplementaries by Ioannis A. Tsoukalas, Paul Rübig and Silvia-Adriana Țicău.
